conclusion: The problem involves determining the output power and total power of a power source when connected to a small light bulb.
The graph shows two lines: a straight line representing the power source and a curved line representing the light bulb.
The intersection point of the two lines indicates the operating point where the voltage across the light bulb equals the voltage provided by the power source.
The intersection point is at \( I = 2 \, \text{A} \) and \( U = 2 \, \text{V} \).
The output power of the power source is calculated as \( P_{\text{out}} = I \times U \).
The internal resistance of the power source is determined using the slope of the straight line.
The slope of the straight line is used to find the internal resistance.
The total power of the power source is calculated as \( P_{\text{total}} = E \times I \).
The final answer is the output power and total power of the power source.
The output power of the power source is \( 4 \, \text{W} \) and the total power of the power source is \( 6 \, \text{W} \).
